subject: CBS News Sunday Morning: Designing our world
body:

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






May 18, 2007,
This Sunday Morning, we’re 
      taking our show on the road: We’re in Chicago, where we’ve 
      got a show about design on our drawing board. 
Our "Sunday Morning By Design" features 
      all kinds of stories about the way we live, the products we use, how we relax, and the way architecture and design 
      are all around us – and affect our lives. 
Rita 
      Braver looks at our never-ending quest for utopian communities, places we’re proud to call 
      home. Then, Tracy Smith explores the ultimate in personal 
      taste: the way plastic surgery 
      can redesign the way we look.
Ever 
      wonder what it’s like to live high above the city? Cynthia Bowers 
      talks with residents of one of Chicago’s tallest, and most famous, 
      apartment buildings: the 100-story John Hancock Center.

From Italy, Allen Pizzey takes a 
      spin in the car that embodies classic car design -- the Ferrari.  And Richard 
      Schlesinger has a look at the ever-shrinking airplane seat, a report unlikely to sit well with 
      frequent flyers.

Time 
      was when hotels were grand and 
      spacious, like Chicago’s famed 
      Conrad Hilton, which we’ll be visiting during the program.  But these 
      days, Anthony Mason will tell us in his interview with hotelier Ian 
      Schrager, the look is sparse, 
      minimal and cutting edge. We’ll check it out.

Of 
      course, not all design projects make it off the drawing board. Leave it to our Bill Geist to find some 
      memorable non-starters.

And 
      for Martha Teichner, the task is evaluating design that endures. She 
      looks at the fine art of the tombstone, grave markers guaranteed 
      to ensure that the departed can 
      truly rest in peace.

Much 
      more, besides, in our 
      "Sunday Morning By Design," from Chicago.

Listen for the trumpet.
